structure.unit: Registration Of Certain Professions And Occupations

text.section: has received a doctoral degree in psychology from a recognized educational institution;

has engaged for the equivalent of at least two years full time, at least one year of which was subsequent to his receiving the doctoral degree, in psychological employment, teaching, research or professional practice under the supervision of or in collaboration with a licensed psychologist, or one clearly eligible for licensure in the opinion of the board; and
conducts his professional activities in accordance with accepted standards such as the Ethical Standards of Psychologists of the American Psychological Association.
